title: Cat. 89  Compote, 1933
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Peer Smed (American, born Denmark, 1878–1943)  
Brooklyn, New York  
Silver; 17.8 × 15.8 cm (7 × 6 3/8 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of the Antiquarian Society through the Mr. and Mrs. James W. Alsdorf Fund, 1986.1061

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">On bottom (fig. 89.1)

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">With Catherine Kurland, New York, by 1986.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1986.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Krekel-Aalberse (1989), p. 117, cat. 107 (ill.).

Naeve (1990), p. 50, fig. 17 (ill.).

Downs (2001), pp. 57–58, cat. 15 (ill.).

Barter et al. (2009b), pp. 218–20, cat. 99 (ill.).

</section><section id="figures">Compote, 1933.

fig. 89.1 </section>
